name: Representation of women in videogames
description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

key_work.title: Retro gaming
key_work.brief_description: Before NBA Jam, there was Atari’s Basketball. Released just in time for the arcade heyday of the early 1980s, it was the first basketball game to use a trackball controller and a 45-degree angled side view.

constellations_primary.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_primary.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

start.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
start.creator_credit: Simon West, Colin Wilson, Jib Polhemus, Lawrence Gordon, Lloyd Levin and Michael Levy
start.headline_credit: Cambodia, Germany, Japan, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2001
start.brief_description: Angelina Jolie stars as the iconic videogame character Lara Croft in this early 2000s adaptation.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Tomb Raider
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
end.brief_description: Lara Croft, the fiercely independent daughter of a missing adventurer, must push herself beyond her limits when she finds herself on the island where her father disappeared.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: By the time the Tomb Raider film franchise was rebooted in 2018, there was less focus on the character’s sexual physicality and more on her athleticism and determination, with Alicia Vikander cast in the lead role.

start.title: Metroid
start.brief_description: It’s you against the evil Mother Brain in the thrilling battle of Metroid! You’re inside the fortress planet Zebes. The planet of endless secret passageways where the Metroid are multiplying. Left alone the Metroid are harmless. But in the wrong hands they could destroy the galaxy. It’s up to you to prevent the Mother Brain that controls Zebes from using the Metroid for evil purposes. But that won’t be easy. You’ll have to use your spacesuit to absorb valuable energy for your search to gain the use of power items like the Ice Beam, Wave Beam, High Jump Boots and Varia. If you survive, it will be you and your acquired powers against the Mother Brain.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

end.title: Alien
end.creator_credit: David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Ivor Powell and Walter Hill
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1979
end.brief_description: During its return to the earth, the spaceship Nostromo intercepts a distress signal from a distant planet. When the crew discovers a chamber containing thousands of eggs on the planet, the crew is unaware of the impending nightmare set to descend upon them…

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

links.description: The personality, grit and bad-assery of Samus Aran was modelled on one of cinema’s greatest female protagonists – Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) in Ridley Scott’s Alien (1979).

start.title: Tomb Raider
start.brief_description: Adventurer Lara Croft has been hired to recover the pieces of an ancient artifact known as the Scion. With her fearless acrobatic style she runs, jumps, swims and climbs her way towards the truth of its origin and powers - leaving only a trail of empty tombs and gun-cartridges in her wake.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Tomb Raider
end.brief_description: Tomb Raider explores the intense and gritty origin story of Lara Croft and her ascent from a young woman to a hardened survivor. Armed only with raw instincts and the ability to push beyond the limits of human endurance, Lara must fight to unravel the dark history of a forgotten island to escape its relentless hold.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: The overt sexualisation of Lara Croft, particularly her anatomical exaggerations, dogged the character for over 10 game titles and 17 years before the character was rebooted in 2013 with a less sexualised representation.

start.title: Super Mario Bros.
start.brief_description: In 1985, Nintendo introduced the world to one of the most iconic and endearing videogame characters of all time, Mario. Well, Super Mario to you. The red overall-wearing plumber bounced his way into history and pop culture consciousness in the first of many videogames.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Metroid
end.brief_description: It’s you against the evil Mother Brain in the thrilling battle of Metroid! You’re inside the fortress planet Zebes. The planet of endless secret passageways where the Metroid are multiplying. Left alone the Metroid are harmless. But in the wrong hands they could destroy the galaxy. It’s up to you to prevent the Mother Brain that controls Zebes from using the Metroid for evil purposes. But that won’t be easy. You’ll have to use your spacesuit to absorb valuable energy for your search to gain the use of power items like the Ice Beam, Wave Beam, High Jump Boots and Varia. If you survive, it will be you and your acquired powers against the Mother Brain.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

links.description: Metroid‘s Samus Aran definitely isn’t a damsel-in-distress. While the bounty hunter plays as genderless during the game because of her armour, at the end of the game she’s revealed to be a woman – the first empowered female protagonist to achieve widespread fame.

start.title: Metroid
start.brief_description: It’s you against the evil Mother Brain in the thrilling battle of Metroid! You’re inside the fortress planet Zebes. The planet of endless secret passageways where the Metroid are multiplying. Left alone the Metroid are harmless. But in the wrong hands they could destroy the galaxy. It’s up to you to prevent the Mother Brain that controls Zebes from using the Metroid for evil purposes. But that won’t be easy. You’ll have to use your spacesuit to absorb valuable energy for your search to gain the use of power items like the Ice Beam, Wave Beam, High Jump Boots and Varia. If you survive, it will be you and your acquired powers against the Mother Brain.

constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

end.title: Tomb Raider
end.brief_description: Adventurer Lara Croft has been hired to recover the pieces of an ancient artifact known as the Scion. With her fearless acrobatic style she runs, jumps, swims and climbs her way towards the truth of its origin and powers - leaving only a trail of empty tombs and gun-cartridges in her wake.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: However… if you finished Metroid in under an hour, Samus appears in a bikini when she takes off her armour. Entering a cheat code also allows users to play Samus, scantily clad, much like a cheat in Tomb Raider (1996), which rendered Lara Croft naked.

start.title: Tomb Raider
start.brief_description: Adventurer Lara Croft has been hired to recover the pieces of an ancient artifact known as the Scion. With her fearless acrobatic style she runs, jumps, swims and climbs her way towards the truth of its origin and powers - leaving only a trail of empty tombs and gun-cartridges in her wake.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
end.creator_credit: Simon West, Colin Wilson, Jib Polhemus, Lawrence Gordon, Lloyd Levin and Michael Levy
end.headline_credit: Cambodia, Germany, Japan, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2001
end.brief_description: Angelina Jolie stars as the iconic videogame character Lara Croft in this early 2000s adaptation.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: The focus on Lara Croft’s physicality directly translated to the film starring Angelina Jolie. It’s been hotly debated about whether the film represents the character as an empowering female lead or object of the male gaze, with Lara often wearing a push-up bra.

start.title: Retro gaming
start.brief_description: Before NBA Jam, there was Atari’s Basketball. Released just in time for the arcade heyday of the early 1980s, it was the first basketball game to use a trackball controller and a 45-degree angled side view.

constellations_primary.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_primary.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Super Mario Bros.
end.brief_description: In 1985, Nintendo introduced the world to one of the most iconic and endearing videogame characters of all time, Mario. Well, Super Mario to you. The red overall-wearing plumber bounced his way into history and pop culture consciousness in the first of many videogames.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: Though Ms. Pac-Man came first, the most famous woman in early videogames is Princess Peach from Super Mario Bros. While Peach wasn’t just a reskinned character, she had no agency and perpetuated the damsel-in-distress trope that proliferated videogames for decades.

start.title: Tomb Raider
start.brief_description: Tomb Raider explores the intense and gritty origin story of Lara Croft and her ascent from a young woman to a hardened survivor. Armed only with raw instincts and the ability to push beyond the limits of human endurance, Lara must fight to unravel the dark history of a forgotten island to escape its relentless hold.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: Tomb Raider
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
end.brief_description: Lara Croft, the fiercely independent daughter of a missing adventurer, must push herself beyond her limits when she finds herself on the island where her father disappeared.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

links.description: By the time a new Tomb Raider movie was made five years later, the representation of Lara Croft reflected the most recent games’ focus on Croft’s ability, skills and athleticism rather than her body. It also followed the game’s storyline.

start.title: Tomb Raider
start.brief_description: Tomb Raider explores the intense and gritty origin story of Lara Croft and her ascent from a young woman to a hardened survivor. Armed only with raw instincts and the ability to push beyond the limits of human endurance, Lara must fight to unravel the dark history of a forgotten island to escape its relentless hold.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

end.title: The Last of Us
end.brief_description: A third person shooter/stealth/survival hybrid, in which twenty years after the outbreak of a parasitic fungus which takes over the neural functions of humans, Joel, a Texan with a tragic familial past, finds himself responsible with smuggling a fourteen year old girl named Ellie to a militia group called the Fireflies, while avoiding strict and deadly authorities, infected fungal hosts and other violent survivors.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

constellations_other.name: Gender avengers
constellations_other.description: Thelma and Louise and Promising Young Woman both celebrate women taking revenge on men who sexually assault them, although victory is temporary as the characters perish because of their choices.

links.description: In 2013, there was another milestone character in the representation of women in videogames – Ellie in The Last of Us (2013). Resourceful, brave and wise, Ellie quickly became one of the most iconic female videogame characters.
